name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: My fellow Americans, today was supposed to be a special day. A day that Donald Trump either had to fork over 464 million dollars for a bond in his New York fraud case or Attorney General Letitia James was going to grab him by the property.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: So he doesn’t have the cash, aha! Caught you now. He’s not a real rich guy, he just plays one on TV. Donald Trump has a billion dollars the same way Patrick Stewart has a spaceship.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: Every time it seems like consequences of any kind are closing in, he gets away with it. Who let this guy wish for more wishes? Especially after how racist he was to the genie?

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: ‘I don’t know, I mean you could. I don’t know, but Russia, if you’re listening, maybe you know if it’s legal. Could you write the answer down on 500 million pieces of paper and have it , Put-in my account?.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: The pundits are saying the courts handed Trump a lifeline. Well that makes sense. By law you have to throw someone a lifeline when they look so much like a waterlogged corpse.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: I have to admit, Donald Trump has done the impossible. He’s made April 15 a day to celebrate.” stephen colbert

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: So, the guiltier he is, the more the crowd loves him? It’s never a great sign when your press conference answers could just as easily be cackled by the Joker.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: Today the CEO of Boeing stepped down. Either that or they never installed the bolts that keep him in the boardroom.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: I’m sorry, but there is no way to avoid Boeing airplanes. Even if you’re just walking down the street.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: Yes the service, just like some of their planes, was tireless.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: Wow, he won both! You know what that means. Somebody else won both.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: She’s attacking him for doing his job. It’s like writing a review for your wedding photographer reading, ‘Zero stars. That pervert took pics of me and my wife kissing!'

name: Jon Stewart
monologue: That’s right, we sat all week in breathless anticipation to see if Trump had 454 million dollars in his wallet. Or would Trump Tower be turned over to New York City, perhaps to ease our terrible housing crunch. Or more likely do what they always do—another s***ty Walgreens.

name: Jon Stewart
monologue: ‘There is a theory in law that if enough people commit a crime, it automatically becomes legal. You’re familiar with The Purge , are you not?'

name: Jon Stewart
monologue: You know what, let’s take a step back. What did Trump actually do to earn this penalty? Well, it turns out that, for a decade, whenever Trump wanted to get a loan or make a deal, he’d he’d illegally inflate the value of his real estate. For instance, suggesting that his 11 thousand square foot penthouse was a 30 thousand square foot penthouse. We all do it. I mean on my drivers license, I’m not listed as 5′ 7″, I’m listed at 30 thousand square feet.” jon stewart

name: Jon Stewart
monologue: And the Attorney General of New York knew that Trump’s property values were inflated because, when it came time to pay taxes, Trump undervalued the very same properties. It’s all part of a very sophisticated real estate practice known as lying.

name: Jon Stewart
monologue: That’s right, woke libs! You think Donald Trump’s a loser? Well would a loser brag about… winning a tournament… at his own course?

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: It’s the first time anyone’s ever heard, ‘Good news! You only owe 175 million dollars!

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: The judge picked April 15 because its Tax Day and he knew Trump wouldn’t be busy.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: Playing the lottery is very fun though. It’s days of buildup and then it’s over in a few seconds. Anyway, Trump’s Stormy Daniels trial is in the news…

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: Boeing announced that its CEO is stepping down. Well, don’t let the blown-out door hit you on the way out.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: After winning, he was honored to receive a congratulatory phone call from himself.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: West Virginia approved a bill that allows people to distill up to five gallons of moonshine. West Virginia said it’s a great way for meth dealers to diversify their portfolio.

name: Seth Meyers
monologue: This is the worst ASPCA commercial I have ever seen.

name: Seth Meyers
monologue: No s**t. You have a better chance getting your money back from a shredder.

name: Seth Meyers
monologue: Boeing announced today that three of its senior executives are stepping down. Or to put in Boeing terms, they were sucked out.

name: Seth Meyers
monologue: Now, the Sweet Sixteen round of NCAA’s March Madness basketball tournament is set to begin… [a picture of under-investigation for underage sex trafficking Rep. Matt Gaetz pops up]… Hey, you get outta here! It’s a different sweet sixteen!
